footer.tagline: Platform for sharing, managing, and utilizing AI coding rules

about.pageDescription: Learn about zxcv, a platform for sharing and managing AI coding rules

hero.title: About zxcv
hero.subtitle: Empowering developers to share and manage AI coding rules for better software development

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content1: zxcv was born from the need to standardize and share AI coding instructions across development workflows. As AI-powered development tools become increasingly prevalent, the need for consistent, high-quality prompts and coding rules has become critical.
mission.content2: Our platform enables developers to create, version, and share their coding rules and AI prompts, ensuring consistency and quality across projects. Whether you're working solo or with collaborators, zxcv helps you maintain coding standards and leverage AI tools effectively.
mission.content3: We believe in the power of community-driven development. By sharing knowledge and best practices, we can collectively improve the way we write code and interact with AI development tools.

openness.title: Open Collaboration
openness.description: We foster an environment where developers can freely share their knowledge and learn from each other's experiences.

security.title: Security First
security.description: Your private rules and data are protected with enterprise-grade security measures.

efficiency.title: Developer Efficiency
efficiency.description: We're committed to building tools that make developers more productive and help collaborators work better together.

contact.title: Get in Touch
contact.description: Have questions or feedback? We'd love to hear from you.

install.pageDescription: Installation guide and setup instructions for the zxcv CLI tool

hero.title: Install zxcv CLI
hero.subtitle: Manage AI coding rules from the command line. Simple npm/bun-like interface for easy rule management.

quickInstall.title: One-liner Installation
quickInstall.description: This command will auto-detect your platform and install the latest version.

script.title: Install Script
script.description: Recommended: Auto-detects platform with checksum verification

1.title: Run the install script
1.description: This command will detect your platform and download the appropriate binary.

2.title: Verify installation
2.description: Check that the installation was successful by checking the version.

3.title: Security verification
3.description: macOS may show security warnings on first run. Allow it in System Preferences > Security & Privacy.

1.title: Download binary
1.description: Download the latest Windows binary from the GitHub Releases page.

3.title: Verify installation
3.description: Check the version using PowerShell or Command Prompt.

2.title: Download binary directly
2.description: Download the latest Linux binary from the GitHub Releases page.

3.title: Verify installation
3.description: Make the binary executable and check the version.

verification.title: Verify Installation
verification.description: You can verify that zxcv CLI is correctly installed with the following command:

init.description: To start using zxcv in a new project, first initialize it.

auth.title: Set up Authentication
auth.description: Authentication is required to access private rules.

explore.title: Explore Rules
explore.description: Discover public rules created by the community and add them to your project.

help.title: Check Help
help.description: Use the help command to learn about all available commands and options.

admin.title: Admin Dashboard
admin.description: Manage moderators and administrative access across the platform.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.dataCollectionText: We collect minimal information necessary to provide our services, including email address, username, and created rules during account registration.
privacy.dataUsageText: Collected data is used solely for service provision, improvement, and security maintenance. We do not provide data to third parties except as required by law.
privacy.dataProtectionText: We protect communications with SSL/TLS encryption and ensure data security through access controls and monitoring systems.
privacy.userRightsText: Users have the right to request disclosure, correction, or deletion of their personal information. You can manage your data at any time through account settings.
privacy.contactText: For privacy-related questions, please contact us through GitHub Issues.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.acceptanceText: By using this service, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service.
terms.serviceUseText: This service is intended for creating, sharing, and managing AI coding rules. Use for illegal activities or harassment is prohibited.
terms.userContentText: Intellectual property rights to rules and content created by users belong to the users. Published content may be viewable by other users.
terms.intellectualPropertyText: Intellectual property rights to this service and its content belong to the operator.
terms.prohibitedUsesText: Illegal activities, spam, malware distribution, rights infringement, system attacks, and similar activities are prohibited.
terms.liabilityText: The operator is not liable for damages arising from the use of this service.
terms.changesText: The operator may change these terms as necessary. Changes will be announced within the site.
terms.contactText: For questions about the Terms of Service, please contact us through GitHub Issues.
